benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/children - List children accounts

covered: Valid requests: Comprehensive success scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC19, TC20) verify default behavior and combinations of accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, and audit levels.
Path parameter validation and error handling: Invalid UUID format (TC09 -> 400), non-existent UUID / parent not found (TC10, TC08 -> 404), and missing path segment (TC25 -> 404) are covered.
Empty / no-data scenarios: parent with no children (TC07), system empty (TC08) and "all children deleted" (TC24) cover empty-response semantics and not-found cases.
Query-parameter handling: Combinations and permutations are exercised (TC06) and malformed/unexpected parameter handling is tested (TC16 -> 400, TC13 ignored extra params).
Authorization: Unauthorized (TC11 -> 401) and insufficient-permission (TC12 -> 403) cases are present.
Error/resilience and security: Dependency down -> 503 (TC14), backend timeout -> 504 (TC18), injection attempt -> 400 (TC17) are covered.
Performance & scale: Large-data scenario (TC15 with 10,000 children) and a response-time target are included.
Concurrency & integration: Concurrent access checks (TC21) and audit-service consistency checks (TC22) are defined.
Data-consistency & regression: New child creation visibility (TC23) and a regression test for missing children when balance requested (TC19) are present.
Response semantics: Presence/absence of balance and CBA fields for relevant query params and default audit NONE are asserted (TC01-TC03, TC04-TC05).
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior (limit/offset/page-size, paging metadata or link headers). TC15 covers large payload performance but does not validate paging.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests exercise throttling or verify 429 + Retry-After behavior under request bursts.
Caching & conditional requests: No tests for ETag, If-None-Match, If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, or 304 responses.
Response headers & media-type validation: Tests do not assert Content-Type (application/json), Cache-Control, Content-Length, or behavior under different Accept headers.

Schema / contract validation: There are assertions about presence/absence of some fields, but no strict JSON Schema or contract tests for the Account object (field types, required properties, nested structures).
Authorization edge-cases: Missing tests for expired/invalid tokens, malformed token formats, and fine-grained scope/claim behaviors beyond generic 401/403.
Internal server error coverage: No explicit test simulating a 500 Internal Server Error path (unexpected exception) — 503 and 504 are covered but not 500.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if the API supports paging): verify default page size, limit/offset or cursor behavior, boundary conditions (empty last page, out-of-range page), and paging metadata or Link headers. If the API is intentionally unpaginated, add an explicit test asserting that and document performance implications.
Add rate-limiting tests: generate burst traffic to validate throttling behavior, assert 429 responses, Retry-After header semantics, and that clients can back off/retry correctly.

Add caching and conditional GET tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since to receive 304 when appropriate, and ensure query-parameter combinations change cache keys as expected.

Validate HTTP headers and content negotiation: assert Content-Type: application/json, test Accept header variants and unsupported media-type handling, and check other relevant headers (Content-Length, Cache-Control).

Introduce strict JSON Schema / contract tests for Account objects: validate required fields, types (e.g., numeric balances), nested audit structure, and verify that each query-parameter combination yields the exact expected schema.
Expand authorization tests to cover expired tokens, malformed tokens, tokens with missing scopes/claims and verify consistent error bodies/headers for each case.
Add robustness tests for unexpected internal errors (simulate 500): verify error code, sanitized error message to clients, and that logs/metrics capture the incident.

For large-response handling: if paging is not available, add tests for streaming/partial reads, memory usage observations, and repeatable performance benchmarks in CI; if paging is available, shift TC15 into paginated validations.

Extend integration fault-injection tests: verify behavior when dependent services (audit, account-service) are slow or return partial failures and ensure API degrades gracefully or surfaces clear errors.
